messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] spanking is hitting
messages.msgSnippet: Actually spanking is just hitting (or worse). Correction usually has something to do with logical consequences or learnig from mistakes. Any fool can hit, it
messages.messageBody:
Actually spanking is just hitting (or worse). Correction usually has something to do with logical consequences or learnig from mistakes. Any fool can hit, it takes thought to teach right from wrong. I don't see how hitting can be applied with love. That's just an oxymoron. Especially bad on small children. How can you teach them that hitting is wrong when you're hitting them? Read, learn, keep trying, but no hitting. This world is too violent already.

Kathy in Avon

>
> Message: 21
> Date: Wed, 28 Jun 2000 11:52:32 -0500
> From: "Dia Garland" <moocow@...>
> Subject: Re: Who's Dr Laura anyway? :)
>
> > doesn't dr. laura also advocate legalized abuse via spanking<<
>
> So spanking is abuse?? According to whom> You?
>
> Spanking is correction, beating is abuse.
>
